subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Growth Mindset: Failure as Fuel
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Growth Mindset: Failure as Fuel.

hook.text: Carol Dweck gave kids identical puzzles. Those praised for effort tried harder. Those praised for talent quit.

buildup.text: A growth mindset believes abilities develop through effort. A fixed mindset believes talent is innate.

discovery.text: Founders with growth mindsets treat failure as data. Those with fixed mindsets treat it as identity.

twist.text: Silicon Valley's 'fail fast' culture is growth mindset institutionalizedâ€”but only if you actually learn.

climax.text: James Dyson built 5,127 failed prototypes before his vacuum worked. Each failure was a lesson, not a verdict.

punchline.text: Failure isn't the opposite of success. It's the tuition.

quiz.question: What defines a growth mindset according to Carol Dweck?
options: Believing that abilities can be developed through dedication and effort
Focusing on growing revenue before all else
Having an innate talent for learning new skills
